snippet: Reiterating a hard-line nationalist approach, Mr. Trump raised new questions about his commitment to automatically defend NATO allies....
abstract: Donald Trump, in interview on eve of accepting Republican presidential nomination, reiterates hard-line nationalist approach toward American foreign policy; questions whether United States can pressure allies on civil rights abuses like those in Turkey, arguing US faces civil rights issues of its own; also casts doubt on whether US should automatically defend its NATO allies, noting their financial contributions to alliance should be taken into account.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: Reiterating a hard-line nationalist approach, Mr. Trump raised new questions about his commitment to automatically defend NATO allies.

headline.main: Donald Trump Sets Conditions for Defending NATO Allies Against Attack
headline.print_headline: Trump Plays Down U.S. Commitment to NATO and Role Abroad
